intro: Echium calycinum, commonly known as the blueweed or sea spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in coastal and sandy environments. The plant produces striking spikes of blue to violet flowers, which bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish or purple in color. Echium calycinum is known for its ability to tolerate saline and well-drained soils, making it a common sight in coastal areas.
